funGUI

Class RectButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • funGUI.Frame
      • funGUI.Button
        • funGUI.RectButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RoundedRectButton

    public class RectButton
extends Button
    The RectButton class is one of the many options included in the FunGUI library for classes. This button returns a boolean if the mouse is pressed over it.
    Author:
    Audrey Seo

    • Constructor Detail

      • RectButton

        public RectButton(processing.core.PApplet p,
                  float nx,
                  float ny,
                  float nw,
                  float nh,
                  java.lang.String ntext)
        Constructor of a rectangular button.
        Parameters:
        p - PApplet, the parent of the sketch, usually "this"
        nx - float, the x-coordinate of the location of the button
        ny - float, the y-coordinate of the location of the button
        nw - float, the width of the button
        nh - float, the height of the button
        ntext - String, the label for the button

      • RectButton

        public RectButton(processing.core.PApplet p,
                  float nx,
                  float ny,
                  float nw,
                  float nh,
                  int[] ncolors,
                  java.lang.String ntext)
        Constructor of a rectangular button.
        Parameters:
        p - PApplet, the parent of the sketch, usually "this"
        nx - float, the x-coordinate of the location of the button
        ny - float, the y-coordinate of the location of the button
        nw - float, the width of the button
        nh - float, the height of the button
        ncolors - color [], the colors of the button (0-outside, 1-overlay (for clicked status), 2-inside)
        ntext - String, the label for the button

      • RectButton

        public RectButton(processing.core.PApplet p,
                  float nx,
                  float ny,
                  float nw,
                  float nh,
                  int[] ncolors,
                  java.lang.String ntext,
                  java.lang.String fontName,
                  int fontSize)
        Constructor of a rectangular button.
        Parameters:
        p - PApplet, the parent of the sketch, usually "this"
        nx - float, the x-coordinate of the location of the button
        ny - float, the y-coordinate of the location of the button
        nw - float, the width of the button
        nh - float, the height of the button
        ncolors - color [], the colors of the button (0-outside, 1-overlay (for clicked status), 2-inside)
        ntext - String, the label for the button
        fontName - String, the name of the font needed for the label (must be compatible with createFont, use PFont.list() if you're not sure)
        fontSize - int, the size of the font for the label

      • RectButton

        public RectButton(processing.core.PApplet p,
                  float nx,
                  float ny,
                  float nw,
                  float nh,
                  int[] ncolors,
                  java.lang.String ntext,
                  processing.core.PFont nfont,
                  int nfsize)
        Constructor of the button with room for specification of the font
        Parameters:
        p - PApplet, the parent of the sketch, usually "this"
        nx - float, the x-coordinate of the location of the button
        ny - float, the y-coordinate of the location of the button
        nw - float, the width of the button
        nh - float, the height of the button
        ncolors - color [], the colors of the button (0-outside, 1-overlay (for clicked status), 2-inside)
        ntext - String, the label for the button
        nfont - PFont, the font of the button's label
        nfsize - int, the size of the font
